node.description:
[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCln9P4Qm3-EAY4aiEPmRwEA) | [NicoNico](http://nicovideo.jp/mylist/58569901) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ado1024imokenp) | [Official Site (Universal Music Japan)](https://www.universal-music.co.jp/ado/)

Ado is a Japanese singer, composer and producer.

In 2014, Ado took an interest in music after a software of the video-sharing website Niconico was released on Nintendo 3DS. She began watching videos on the small screen of Nintendo 3DS, and was impressed by the cover singers on Niconico, who sang without showing their faces. Years later in 2017, Ado began singing as an utaite on Niconico, after uploading a video of herself singing a cover of "Kimi no taion".

On October 23, 2020, the day before her 18th birthday, she made her debut with the digital single titled "Usseewa". The song peaked at number 1 on Billboard Japan Hot 100, Oricon Digital Singles Chart, and the Oricon Streaming Chart. The music video of the song on her YouTube channel reached 100 million views in 148 days after its release. Reaching 100 million plays on Billboard Japan after 17 weeks from charting-in was the sixth fastest in history and the youngest for a solo singer. She currently belongs to the artist management company Cloud Nine.

On June 11, 2021, she was chosen as the second Japanese female Artist for "YouTube's Artist on the Rise".

On January 26, 2022, she released Kyougen (狂言), her first album.

On June 26, 2024, the J-Pop music group produced by Ado, Phantom Siita (ファントムシータ) debuted.

On July 10, 2024, she released Zanmu (残夢), her second album.

__Residency:__ Kawasaki City, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Keio University

__[Website](http://www.ksp-songs.com/canon.html) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/can0stagram/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kanon.yamamoto)__

__Kanon Yamamoto__, better known as Canon. (stylized as cAnON.) is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger and vocalist.

Daughter of __[Kenji Yamamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/223536)__.

[Website](http://www.sawanohiroyuki.com/) | [Website (nZk)](http://www.sh-nzk.net) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/sawano_nZk) | [Instagram (Official)](https://www.instagram.com/hiroyukisawano.official/) | [Instagram (Personal)](https://www.instagram.com/sawano__hiroyuki/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/SawanoHiroyukiSMEJ) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0Riv2KnFcLZA3JSVryRg4y?si=KaE_XDXqSRewfXXsxBNzoA) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/hiroyuki-sawano/156620523) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/1315147) 

Composer and musician represented by VV-ALKLINE since 2017. He was previously with Legendoor from 2006 to 2017. 
Sawano began practicing the piano at an early age, and studied composition, arrangement, orchestration, and piano under Nobuchika Tsuboi from the age of 17.

Active as a composer since 2004, he first gained recognition for his work on the Team Medical Dragon TV drama in 2006. He made his debut as an anime composer in 2006 on [Soul Link](https://anilist.co/anime/854/). In 2009, he released his first solo album *musica*, which included some of his more popular songs done for TV shows. In 2014, he launched a new vocal song project under the name "SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]", producing the first album *UnChild* with [Aimer](https://anilist.co/staff/107859/) as the vocalist under the name SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]:Aimer. Since then his songs under this vocal song project have also been used as the opening and ending themes for various anime.

He has cited [Joe Hisaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/100738/), [Youko Kanno](https://anilist.co/staff/95508/), [Hans Zimmer](https://anilist.co/staff/104669/) and Danny Elfman as major inspirations.

Non-anime role:

• **Xenoblade Chronicles X (music)** 
• **Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition (music)**

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kohta_yamabook) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yamabook_kohta/) | [Website](https://www.kohtayamamoto.net/)

Formerly affiliated with Legendoor, he is now in business partnership with VV-ALKLINE.

[Profile (SIGN SOUND)](https://signsound.net/engineer/mitsunori-aizawa) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/mitsunori.aizawa.9) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/mitsu_music/)

Recording and mixing engineer affiliated with SIGN SOUND since 2012. Formerly affiliated with Mixer's Lab from 2004-2007 and Studio Sound Valley from 2007-2012.

[Profile (SIGN SOUND)](https://signsound.net/engineer/mitsunori-aizawa) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/mitsunori.aizawa.9) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/mitsu_music/)

Recording and mixing engineer affiliated with SIGN SOUND since 2012. Formerly affiliated with Mixer's Lab from 2004-2007 and Studio Sound Valley from 2007-2012.

[Profile (Joint1)](http://www.joint1.net/index.php?ENGINEER%20and%20WORKS%2FWORKS#sasagawa)

Recording engineer affiliated with recording studio Joint1.

__Residency:__ Shibuya, Tokyo, Japan

__[Artist Profile (MFM)](https://www.musicformusic.jp/creators/naokiitai/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/NaokI_Edge)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/naoki.itai)__

__Introduction:__
Naoki Itai is a Japanese composer, arranger and sound producer who works for company [MUSIC FOR MUSIC Inc.](http://www.musicformusic.jp/)

__Biography:__
He started playing the guitar at the age of 14, and started working as a professional guitarist at the age of 19. As of recent he is involved in producing music for various artists as a sound producer for company Music for Music, which operates the music studio "FORSTA".
